get.summary: Get documents in the workspace accessible to the calling user
get.description:
This operation retrieves the documents in the workspace that are accessible to the calling user. Documents may be added directly or automatically through tasks such as envelopes. Documents may be used to create envelopes.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of documents to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description: Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0

parameters.name: name_filter
parameters.description: Filter documents where Name contains the filter. Defaults to null, to not filter

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

post.summary: Add a document to a workspace via file contents upload
post.description:
This operation adds a document to a workspace via file contents upload. The file is passed in the request body as a multipart/form-data file. The file name is used as the document name.

Once added, it may be used to create an envelope associated with the workspace.

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

get.description: This operation retrieves information about the document. The response includes the document ID, name, and metadata.

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

delete.summary: Deletes a document in the workspace
delete.description: This operation permanently deletes a document by ID.

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

get.summary: Get the file contents of the document
get.description: This operation retrieves the file contents of the document. The file is returned as a stream in the response body. The Content-Disposition response header contains the document name as the `filename`.

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request.

get.summary: Retrieves the list of users in the given workspace
get.description:
This operations retrieves the users in a workspace. Users sent envelopes or assigned tasks will automatically be added to the workspace with the Participate role.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of workspace users to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100.

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description: Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Returns workspace users filtered by Name and Email

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorts results. Options are `first_name_asc`, `first_name_desc`, `last_name_asc`, `last_name_desc`, `email_asc`, `email_desc`. Defaults to `last_name_desc`

200.description: The workspace user was successfully retrieved

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

post.summary: Adds a user to the workspace by email address
post.description:
This operation manually adds an internal or external user to a specific workspace by email address. Users within the account are considered "Internal" and may be assigned any role. Users outside the account are considered "External" and may only be assigned the Participate role. This operation is not typically needed for adding external participants to a Workspace as they will be automatically added as tasks are assigned.

Available role IDs can be retrieved via the Assignable Roles operation on a workspace. If the `role_id` is not passed, the user is added with the Participate role.

201.description: The user was successfully added to the workspace

400.description: The user could not be added to the workspace

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

put.description: This operation updates the specified user's role in the workspace. Users within the account are considered "Internal" and may be assigned any role. Users outside the account are considered "External" and may only be assigned "External" roles.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to update

requestBody.description: The user details to update to including the RoleId

200.description: The workspace user was successfully updated

400.description: The workspace user could not be updated

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

post.summary: Revokes the specified user's access to the workspace
post.description: This operation revokes the specified user's access to the workspace. The optional `revocation_date` may be set to schedule revocation in the future. If not specified, the revocation will be immediate.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to revoke access from

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to be revoked from the workspace

requestBody.description: Optional details. Allows scheduling the revocation for the future

204.description: The workspace user's access was successfully revoked

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

post.summary: Restores the specified user's access to the workspace
post.description: This operation restores the specified user's access to the workspace. The user must have been previously revoked from the workspace. The access is immediately restored.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to restore access

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to be restored to the workspace

204.description: The workspace user's access was successfully restored

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

get.summary: Gets workspaces available to the calling user
get.description:
This operation retrieves a list of workspaces available to the calling user. It returns basic information about each workspace, including its unique identifier (ID), name, and metadata such as when it was created and by whom.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of workspaces to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description: Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

post.description:
This operation creates a new workspace. The calling user is automatically added as a member of the workspace with the role of Manage.

Once created, the `workspace_id` is utilized to associate tasks such as envelopes. Participants on tasks will automatically be added to the workspace with the Participate role.

requestBody.description: The details of the workspace to be created including the name

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

get.description: This operation retrieves details about a specific workspace. It returns the workspace's unique identifier (ID), name, and metadata such as when it was created and by whom.

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

get.summary: Returns the roles the caller can assign to workspace users
get.description:
This operation returns roles that are assignable to users in the workspace based on the caller's role in the workspace. Roles available include Manage (internal) and Participate (external). Participate is the default role.

Users within the account are considered "Internal" and may be assigned any role. Users outside the account are considered "External" and may only be assigned "External" roles.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A search filter that returns assignable roles by the beginning of the role name

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description: The index position within the total result set from which to start returning values. The default value is 0

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of results to return. This value must be a number between 1 and 100 (default)

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

post.summary: Creates an envelope with the given documents. Returns the ID of the created envelope
post.description:
This operation creates an envelope associated with the workspace. Using the `envelope_id` from the response, eSignature APIs may be utilized to modify the envelope and ultimately send it.

Envelope recipients will automatically be granted Participate access to the workspace. Envelope recipients will receive consolidated notifications from Docusign Workspaces rather than standard individual envelope notifications.

Docusign Connect events may be utilized to receive updates to individual envelope events.

The `envelopes` operation on the workspace may be utilized to query the status of all the envelopes in the workspace.

When `document_ids` is empty or excluded, the envelope is created without any documents from the workspace. eSignature API calls, including adding documents and templates, may be utilized to modify the envelope before it is sent. The eSignature API must be utilized to send the envelope.

requestBody.description: The details of the envelope to be created including the list of document IDs to add to the envelope

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

get.summary: Returns the envelopes associated with the given workspace
get.description: This operation retrieves a list of all associated workspace envelopes. The `status` on each envelope can be used to track envelope progress. Based on the permissions of the caller, additional envelope details may be retrieved from the eSignature API using the `envelope_id`.

400.description: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

401.description: Not authorized to make this request

created_date.description: The date the workspace was created

created_by_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the workspace

workspace_owner_ids.description: The list of user IDs of the workspace owners

role_id.description: The ID of the role assigned to the user

first_name.description: The first name of the user

last_name.description: The last name of the user

message.description: A brief message describing the error condition

error_code.description: A standardized code that generalizes the specific error

ErrorDetails.description: The error response object for the Workspaces API

roles.description: The list of roles that can be assigned to the workspace

result_set_size.description: The number of roles returned in the response. Always equal or less than the `count` of the request

start_position.description: Position of the first item in the total results

end_position.description: Position of the last item in the total results

total_row_count.description: The total number of roles applicable to the request regardless of pagination. It may not always be computed

current_role_id.description: The optional ID of the current role. It may not always be computed

owner_id.description: The ID of the owner of the document

size.description: The size of the document in bytes

created_date.description: The date the document was created

documents.description: The document summary list. Includes the ID, name, and metadata

result_set_size.description: The number of documents returned in the response. Always equal or less than the `count` of the request

end_position.description: Position of the last item in the total results

total_row_count.description: The total number of documents in the workspace applicable to the request regardless of pagination. It may not always be computed

workspace_owner_ids.description: The list of user IDs of the workspace owners

workspaces.description: The workspace summary list. Includes the ID, name, and creation metadata

result_set_size.description: The number of workspaces returned in the response. Always equal or less than the `count` of the request

end_position.description: Position of the last item in the total results

total_row_count.description: The total number of workspaces applicable to the request regardless of pagination. It may not always be computed

revocation_date.description: The optional date in the future to initiate the revocation. If not specified, the revocation will be immediate

role_id.description: The ID of the role assigned to the user

owner_id.description: The ID of the user who owns the document

size.description: The size of the document in bytes

created_date.description: The date the document was created

last_updated_date.description: The date the document was last updated

first_name.description: The first name of the document owner

last_name.description: The last name of the document owner

document_ids.description: The optional list of document IDs to be added to the envelope

status.description: The status of the envelope in the workspace

created_date.description: The date the envelope was created

last_updated_date.description: The date the envelope was last updated

WorkspaceEnvelopeSummary.description: The summary of the envelope in the workspace

is_external.description: If this role is applicable to any participant of a workspace including those outside the account. If false, this role may only be assigned to internal users of the same account

created_date.description: The date the role was created
The date the workspace was created

created_by_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the workspace

email.description: The email address of the added user. May be an internal user to the account or an external user

first_name.description: The first name of the added user

last_name.description: The last name of the added user

role_id.description: The optional Role ID to assign to the user. Defaults to the "Participate" role
